summary: This is an internal email chain from September 2019 discussing the inadvertent release of US Marshals Service (USMS) documents related to the Epstein investigation to a reporter. The emails express concern that this early outreach could have compromised the investigation and note the release was the subject of a New York Times article.

events.title: USMS FOIA Disclosure to Reporter
events.description: The US Marshals Service inadvertently released documents related to the Epstein investigation to a reporter at the very beginning of the investigation.

events.title: Internal Discussion of USMS Disclosure
events.description: Internal email discussion regarding the USMS's inadvertent FOIA disclosure to a reporter and its potential to have compromised the early investigation.

keyFacts: The US Marshals Service (USMS) inadvertently released Epstein-related documents to a reporter early in the investigation.
The disclosure was the subject of a New York Times article circulated internally.
The internal email expresses concern that this outreach 'miraculously did not result in the entire investigation being blown in its initial weeks.'
The released documents pertained to a 'stand-alone part of the early investigation' not handled by the current team members.
The correspondence involves an Associate General Counsel from the USMS and recipients from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
